field_edited_text.value:
State Roads Commission. -6= October 15, 1938.

Chesapeake Bay Bridge



Sandy Point—Kent Island Site









Length
Abutment to abutment,...... o vcvmsmowwsness 21,510 feet
Pandy Polnt approdthic oo oo su om s smamms e nmes 3121
Kent Island approach....................... 1741
Totgl Length. . oovvoeorviee 26,372 feet
Width
Roadway between CUYDS.::v:vivurwrvisvsnsas 24 feet
Emergency walkways, 2 @ 1 foot 6 inches.... 3
Railings, 2 @ L £00b.: svs cusm-nsammenswmanss 2
Total Width............... 29 feet
Channel Span
Lateral learanee ., . vovsonwsmomes vmepessss 1200 feet
Vertiecal Cleglante .. s woeomssse s saa bgs s 175
Mazimum Water depth. . .ovovvmesnassans nmons s 55
Maximum depth estimated water surface
to pile Yefusal. . .oosvsssowenvsmnsms mns 140
Substructure

Concrete piers and abutments on steel and concrete piles
with wrought iron bands at water line.

Superstructure

Structural grade and silicon steel cantilever type A main
span, type C main approaches, and simple trusses, girders
and beams for approaches in shore.

Roadway
Steel open grid type filled with concrete.

Gross Revenue from Tolls

From $875,000 to $885,000 per annum, average for
first five years of operation, from 1941 to 1945.



Maintenance and Operation Expenses

Maintenance and Operation expenses applicable to the Chesapeake
Bay Bridge, Sandy Point site alone, $96,000 per annum.



Total Estimated Cost of Bridge and Approaches Exclusive of
Interest During Construction and Bond Discount.......... $14,110,000



The maintenance and operation expenses listed hereinbefore under
each of the crossings cover operation, maintenance and insurance with about-
five per .cent contingencies, but does not include general and administrative
expense which will vary in amount, depending upon the number of bridges to
be included in the program and the proportionate part of these items of ex-
pense which may be borne by the Commission and paid for from funds other than
toll revenues.

We have previously reported to you that the War Department
Engineers have signified to us the basis upon which they will approve plans
for a bridge across the Chesapeake Bay at Sandy Point. Our report is based
